greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows in which row n gives expansion of the polynomial Product_{k=0..n} (1 + x^(2*k + 1)), n >= -1.
comment: T(n, k) is the number of partitions of k into distinct odd parts not larger than 2*n+1. Also, the number of self-conjugate partitions of k into at most n+1 parts. Also, the number of self-conjugate partitions of 2*n+k+3 into exactly n+2 parts.
Rows are symmetric: T(n, k) = T(n, (n+1)^2 - k).
Within the range 0 <= k <= (n+1)^2, T(n, k) = 0 iff k = 2 or k = (n+1)^2 - 2.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = -1..40, flattened
Rosa, Alexander; Znam, Stefan, A combinatorial problem in the theory of congruences. (Russian), Mat.-Fys. Casopis Sloven. Akad. Vied 15 1965 49-59. [Annotated scanned copy] See Table 2.
formula: T(n, k) = Sum_{i < n} T(i, k - 2*i - 3), if k > 0.
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(
xref: Rows give A169987-A169995. See also A002522 (row lengths). Cf. A142724, A000079(n+1) (row sums).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 25 2010
